thread.title: One dead after wrong-way driver crash, BCSO says
thread.title_full: One dead after wrong-way driver crash, BCSO says | Albuquerque Journal News

author: Elise Kaplan / Journal Staff Writer
title: One dead after wrong-way driver crash, BCSO says
text:
One person is dead after a head-on collision with a wrong-way driver in the East Mountains on Tuesday afternoon, according to a spokesman for the Bernalillo County Sheriff’s Office.
Sgt. Aaron Williamson said that around 4:30 p.m. a sport utility vehicle was traveling south in the northbound lane of Mountain Valley Road when it struck a car traveling north.
The driver of the passenger car was pronounced deceased on scene,” Williamson said. “The wrong-way driver of the SUV was transported to UNMH with head and back injuries.”
Traffic detectives are investigating to determine the cause of the crash, he said. They have not determined whether alcohol is a factor. Mountain Valley Road was closed between Crestview and Fire Lizard.
-This is a developing story. More information will be provided as it becomes available.
